intro: Taraktogenos anomala, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. Its leaves are fleshy and thick, adapted to store water in its native arid environments. Taraktogenos anomala is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
